sections.text: certification, defined.Actuarial certification shall mean a written statement by a member of the American Academy of Actuaries or other individual acceptable to the director that a small employer carrier is in compliance with the provisions of section 44-5258 based upon the person's examination and including a review of the appropriate records and the actuarial assumptions and methods used by the small employer carrier in establishing premium rates for applicable health benefit plans.SourceLaws 1994, LB 1222, ยง 4.

44-5226.Actuarial certification, defined.

Actuarial certification shall mean a written statement by a member of the American Academy of Actuaries or other individual acceptable to the director that a small employer carrier is in compliance with the provisions of section 44-5258 based upon the person's examination and including a review of the appropriate records and the actuarial assumptions and methods used by the small employer carrier in establishing premium rates for applicable health benefit plans.

SourceLaws 1994, LB 1222, ยง 4.
